text: We were originally told NOT to fork the repository and to clone it. Just confirming that direction has changed?

elements.text: We were originally told NOT to fork the repository and to clone it. Just confirming that direction has changed?

text: Also what do we do if we already started with a clone and not fork?

elements.text: Also what do we do if we already started with a clone and not fork?

text:
<@U055S98U8G2> - Per Melinda's announcement in <#C050FRKHFCJ|class-announcements> - she is saying that TAs need to add us as contributors if we aren't showing up on our GitHub projects.

It is my understanding that you will not show up as a contributor in Git Hub until you make a commit to the main branch based on what I am reading. (Further evidenced by the fact that Yumi is the only one from our team showing up as a contributor because she is the only one who has made a commit to the main branch.)

So I don't think it's as simply as asking you or our TAs to make sure we are all contributors, as I'm not sure you have explicit control over that from what I understand.

Someone who is more knowledgable than me though, please weigh in. I am flagging it because it seems like it's something we're being graded on and will be dropped if it doesn't show up based on her announcement.
